1.content:
Gina went into the office, a small, dumpy, trailor, set up on the outskirts of the dig. Paul, as usual, was hunched in front of the computer monitor, tapping away at the keys.

She took her bandana from around her neck and ran cool tap water over it, wiping a layer of dust from her face, rinsing it and replacing it around her neck. She went into the small bathroom, bumping her knees on the wall as she sat down. Finished, she looked into the hazy mirror, trying to comb her fingers through her naturally curly, dirty blonde hair and decided it was hopeless. The mexican sun and wind had defeated every effort to remain intact.

When she came out, Paul was still typing away relentlessly at the keyboard.

"Hey", she said, throwing her arms around him and kissing the back of his neck, "Are you coming out to help me dig today, or am I going to discover the next dinosaur all by myself?"

"Gina, you won't believe this e-mail someone sent me", he said, not even turning around.

"What kind of nut sent you an e-mail this time? No more mummys, ok? I've had enough egyptian curses to last me a lifetime."
1.title: Mystery of the Atlantis

11.content:
Paul backed his chair up and drew her down upon his lap and pointed at the monitor screen.

"Look, this old guy that's in the hospital, claims that he was one of the army people that went to the Roswell crash site and later assigned to the place where they took the alien's bodies. He says he was touched by one that was still alive and has a mark on his wrist, that never has healed. Also found were some scrolls, in the wreckage, all damaged by fire, except one. He was good friends with one of the lab guys that studied the bodies, spacecraft and the scroll. The scroll was on a material never seen here on Earth and was mostly hieroglyphics, or writing with pictures."

"I know what that is, thank you."

"Sorry, sometimes I forget how smart you really are.", he joked, and was promptly beat upon.
11.title: Atlantis and aliens?

choices: laugh at Paul for a good prank
111.content:
"Uncle! Can I continue please?"

She stopped hitting on him and he continued.

"Now, the language expert spent many years trying to decipher the scroll and finally he did. This is where it gets really farfetched, but in actuality, it makes sense. The scroll decribes the lost city of Alantis and that the aliens are claiming that they built it and lived there a long time ago. Not the same ones that actually built the city, because they did eventually leave and go back to their own planet to die, but some from the same planet, fleeing the friction of an opposing planet. Somehow the elders, the first Alantis inhabitants, had somehow known of the eventual takeover of their planet and wanted to provide a safe haven for what was left of their race. But the opposing planet learned of their plot to escape, pursued them, and shot them down in the desert at Roswell." He stopped to catch his breath and looked at Gina for her reaction.
111.title: Another Roswell coverup

1111.content:
"Wow. You really believe that there was a city under the ocean all that time that nobody knew about it? Even in this day and time, it hasn't been discovered, what about radar like on warships looking for mines and stuff?"

"Cetain water conditions cause sound rays to diverge, creating a so-called shadow zone, like in between shallow and deep, that's where a submarine cannot be detected by sonar. That's still way down, but not so deep, it couldn't be found by diving."

She knew that look in his eyes. "And where are you dragging me to, to go alien hunting?"

"The Indian Ocean.", he said, as he dumped her in the chair as he went to retrieve a bottled water from the fridge.

"Ok, Einstein.", she said, as she spun the chair around to face him. "We're going to look for Atlantis, not in the Atlantic, but in the Indian ocean, way over there by India?"

"Ahhh, my little dinosaur digger, Atlantis was 11,000 years ago and all the ocean was the Atlantic at that time. We have the information to go and find this lost city and be notably famous for the rest of our lives."

"Shoot! Why couldn't it be the Fountain of Youth and we could be famous for a really long time!"

He hugged her hard and kissed her. She could not deny an adventure anymore than he and he loved her for it.
1111.title: Two for an adventure

11111.content:
Five weeks since the strange e-mail had passed and Paul and Gina had wrapped up their dig and had gotten in touch with their good friend Mack Cauldwell. Mack, six foot three and slightly balding, was independently rich, owned his own diving boat, and lucky for them, was currently looking for a new venture to sponsor. It hadn't taken much prompting from his old friends to get him to join the adventure.

Another lucky sign, was that Mack, his wife and shipmate, Celia, were on a wild goose chase in Tanzania, Africa and agreed to meet them at Farfangana, a small port outside of Madagascar. According to Paul's sources, Atlantis should be just off a small island to the east of there.

Having met their friends at the port, now gliding over the waves of the brillant blue Indian Ocean, a toast was in order for old friendships and new adventures.

"Here's to clear sailing.", said Celia, raising her wine glass to the sun.

"Here's to not getting seasick.", Gina said sincerly.

"Here's to actually finding something and recouping some of my lost funds.", Mack said, half joking, half serious.

"Here's to the two most beautiful women, and to conquering the lost city of Atlantis."

They all said here, here and drank down their wine.
11111.title: Help from our friends

111111.content:
They had been on the boat for two days and were closing in on their destination. Gina sat on the top deck, watching a pair of dolphins, swimming just ahead of the boat. She was glad she hadn't gotten sick, the patch behind her ear was working.
She looked down at Paul, deep in discussion with Mack at the moment, on the lower deck. She had met him on a dig in Spain, she, a bored girl from Texas, who had barely been out of the state, decided to broaden her horizons and volunteer to work a dig in a country where she couldn't even speak the language. Paul, on the otherhand, was fluent in Spanish, French, German and had been to college forever and had majored in archeology and minored in marine biology and forensic sciences and was very serious when he worked. She could speak pig latin, if that counted and could always break his serious spell and make him laugh.

They had fallen in love among the dust and ruins of the dig and he'd gotten down on one knee, in front of all the professors and volunteers, and proposed. They were married at the very same dig site. When Paul had said he'd give her the world, she hadn't the foggiest notion that he'd actually meant it, until the many places had become a blur.
He was her rock, teacher and best friend.
111111.title: Romance is a big adventure

1111111.content:
Paul noticed Gina looking at him and smiled at her just as she turned back to look at something else. She was beautiful sitting there, hair flying behing her, tan legs drawn up under her chin. Every day he loved her more, discovered something new about her and cursed the day that either should die and break the bond between them. Before her, he had been just another boring professor, consumed by his work. Gina had reminded him to stop and smell the flowers and that the dinosaurs had died a long time ago and were not going anywhere. She was so gosh darned,bloody, logical and he adored her for it.

Mack and Celia had been their friends for five years. Paul had read about some of Mack's expeditions and gave him a call. They had hit it off and agreed to meet in London, Mack's next stop and Paul's next conference. That's all it took for the two to agree on a couple of excursions and of course Gina and Celia were dragged along and had hit it off too. Mack and Celia were in their sixtys, Paul and Gina their thirtys, but it didn't matter, they all had the love of adventure to keep their tongues wagging for hours.
1111111.title: Adventurous souls unite

11111111.content:
Celia went over to give her husband a hug, trying to reach around his thick waist with her short arms. His dark hair was peppered with gray. He had on a Tommy Boy t-shirt, khaki shorts and slip resistant loafers, real leather, no doubt. He towered over his wife of five feet four. Celia, however, was not ready to let her hair go gray and still colored it with Gentle Care, Mink Tresses, #127, which most matched her faux fur coats. Dressed in matching, knee length shorts and top, with slip resistant deck shoes, she was a better sailor than Mack was, so most of the navigating was left up to her. She got her hug and walked back to the control panel, taking it off autopilot, taking the steering back into her control. Half an hour later, Celia killed the engine.

"Alright Paul, according to your directions of longitude and latitude, this is the place where all the ports from here align. Five points, two west, one north, and two due east, x marks the spot."

Celia lowered the anchor, as they all watched it slip beneath the dark surface below the boat.
11111111.title: Waiting is the hardest part

111111111.content:
It was early in the day yet and they decided to dive right away. Donned in wetsuits and airtanks, Gina, Paul, and Mack were ready to dive. Celia would stay aboard and keep watch out for thieves and bad weather. Gina and Paul flipped off the back of the boat and Mack jumped in feet first.

As they swam down, the water got cooler, then warm again. They saw schools of barracuda and silversides, that gleamed in the sunlight, filtering through the water above them. A lone trumpet fish awam along, paying no attention to the divers. They came upon the bottom, but that couldn't be, they had only been in the water for half an hour or so. Paul signaled them to surface. They lifted their masks to speak.

"We shouldn't have hit bottom so soon. What do you make of it Paul?", Mack asked him.

"No, we shouldn't have, not for another half hour. I'm wondering if it's a false bottom, perhaps created by an earthquake or something. It's been thousands of years, alot of ground could have shifted since then. I say we go down again and look for any cracks large enough for us to fit through and have a good look around."
111111111.title: Dive, dive, dive

1111111111.content:
The plan was set, the next day they headed out much as they had the day before. Ceclia staying on board while Gina, Paul, and Mack went diving. The cool water was greeted with pleasure by the three companions but it was hard to enjoy when deep with in them lurked a hope for something amazing. A hope they were bitterly afraid would be dashed the moment they reached the bottem and realized that all their theories had been wrong.

Paul reached the bottom first, it took hardly any time at all. This can't be the real bottom, he thought and began to feel his way along the rocky floor. Gina joined him, followed by Mack. They searched for quite a while without result. It was Gina who finally signalled them both to her. She had appeared from behind a particulary dangerous spot where the seaweed and underwater plants were thick and threatened to tangle them in there watery vines. Mack and Paul followed her as she swam deeper into the under water jungle and presently they came to a rock face, but in it was a crack . . . just large enough for them to slip through. Paul's heart caught in his throat.

The three passed through the opening into complete darkness, no light penetrated into these dark recesses. Mack switched on his under water light and shined it down into the depths of the cavern. They could not see the bottom. Paul motioned them to follow deeper in. The bottom couldn't be that far, they were only about a half hour short of being where the real bottom should lay. But after swimming for a half hour they had still not reached the bottem and Mack's high beam light showed no sign of them being even close. How was this possible? They should have reached the ocean floor by now. He looked to his two companions. He could tell they were both freezing. He too was cold, the water down here was like ice. Gina looked at him and without need for spoken words they began to head back to shore. They had a lot to talk about and deep in Paul's heart he hoped that this discovery, this bottomless cavern meant that there was truth behind the story of Atlantis.
1111111111.title: Bottomless Cavern

choices: "I have to check my email," said Paul, "I have an idea."
Head back to land and rethink this whole thing through
11111111111.content:
"It's way too deep!" yelled Mack, slamming his heavy fist on the table, "Our skulls will be crushed by the pressure."
"He's right," added Gina quietly. She knew Paul was seriously disappointed. They had made it this far, and now their mortality - their humanity - had gotten in their way.
“I think we can do it,” insisted Paul, “We’re highly trained for high atmospheric pressures, and our tanks can support over four hours of oxygen.”
“Not at that depth you won’t make it,” interrupted Celia.
Everyone froze. Celia had her share of deep-sea experience. Her father used to take her diving as a young child. He was a deep-sea diver for the U.S.navy, and he took his diving very seriously. Celia took it seriously too, and followed in her father's footsteps. Her father was in the Explosive Ordnance Disposal unit, and he handled live explosives on a regular basis.
One day, when Celia was finishing her training in the Amphibious Recon unit, she got the news. Her father, a Master Diver, had died in an explosion. Celia never dove again since that fateful day. When it came to deep-sea diving nobody argued with Celia.
“Your body would fill up with nitrogen so fast, that you’d puke out your lungs,” she began, “the only way to avoid the Bends would be to inhale Keller gas and more importantly, by wearing an armored suit.”
Keller gas is a blend of nine gases developed by a Swiss mathermatician named Hannes Keller. This blend facilitates breathing at intense atmospheric pressures and is more commonly used by deep miners hundreds of feet under ground.
Paul broke the silence that followed, “We’d never fit through that crack in armored suits.”
“We could use explosi...” Gina cut herself off abruptly, realizing the touchiness of this topic. She shot Celia a look that said, “I’m sorry,” and put her hands in her lap.
Things were getting tense, and Paul’s dream was getting farther away.
11111111111.title: Under Pressure....

choices: Go to the beach and wait for Heath
Go up on deck and tell the others about Heath
111111111111.content:
Paul shot Gina a melancholy glance; desperation was in his eyes. She knew what he was thinking because it was one of his first thoughts when they decided upon this mission. They both agreed not to go with that choice, but now, it seemed like the only one.
“Do what you’ve got to do,” said Gina quaintly, and proceeded to walk up to deck.
Paul was going to contact Heath Browning, also known as “The Lizard.” He was the son of a multimillionaire, and he had nothing better to do than to spend his money on expensive thrills. He was cocky, he was rude and he treated women like his playthings. Gina hated him the first time she met him, so when Paul mentioned him a few weeks before their voyage, she promptly said, “No.”
One example of Heath Browning throwing money in the wind for a thrill was the time he bought a brand new Ferrari Testarossa. He wanted to see how fast it really was; he wanted to see how aerodynamic it was. It cost him half a million dollars to buy the car. It was beautiful; dark red, shiny chrome tires. He even had a ten thousand dollar sound system installed in it. Then he let it fly. He rented a cargo plane, brought it to thirty thousand feet and drove the luxury sports car out into the clouds.
Apparently, the people at Ferrari hadn’t built it for that kind of aerodynamics because once he reached about a hundred miles an hour, parts started flying off. First, he lost the rearview mirrors, then the hood. His trunk opened up, sending the spare tire flying into the blue, taking the tailgate with it. Heath, who was behind the wheel, head banging to some generic heavy metal band blasting on the hi-fi, considered telling the Ferrari people that their cars didn’t fare well in the skies. Instead, he opened the door and jettisoned himself through space.
This was Heath Browning. Born in Brighton, England, raised in London and schooled in the best institutions money can buy. This was whom Paul nervously typed to. He knew Heath wouldn’t turn down his offer. This was just his cup of tea. Paul hit the ‘send’ button and took a deep breath. He watched the blue on blue of the Indian Ocean horizon and leaned back. A beep startled him.
“New Message,” read the laptop. It was Heath, always quick on the uptake.
“I’ll be right there,” was his reply, “See you on the beach.”
Paul prayed that he made the right decision.
111111111111.title: The Lizard

1111111111111.content:
“You did what?” asked Mack angrily, “That guy’s an asshole!”
“I know,” replied Paul, “But he has the right equipment. We could never afford that kind of stuff.”
“I can’t believe you asked that maniac to come along,” said Celia, “I have a bad feeling about this.”
A few hours later, on their way to the rendezvous point, Paul stood on deck looking at the ocean. They took it pretty well, he thought, with a half smile on his face.
Heath Browning wrote him a detailed email with the coordinates for a meeting place. They were to meet on the aptly named Reunion Island, although this wasn’t necessarily going to be a happy reunion. Reunion is a French island just east of Madagascar, and west of Mauritius. Their meeting point was a small port twenty miles south of Saint Denis, northeast of Le Port.
They arrived to Reunion at sunset and set up camp on the beach. Mack made a fire, while Paul began preparing for dinner. The two women were searching for firewood in the dense jungle a few feet from shore. Heath was to meet them in the morning.
Suddenly, a scream came from the thick foliage. Paul turned around startled.
“Celia,” said Mack, grabbing a paring knife and running into the jungle.
Paul ran after him with a flaming torch in his hand. Branches and vines whipped his face as he kept up behind Mack. The darkness had already begun to seep into the forest, and visibility was getting scarcer by the minute. Suddenly, Paul saw a figure run straight into Mack. Mack was knocked down by the impact. As he drew nearer, Paul realized that it was Celia. A few steps behind, was Gina.
“There’s somebody following us,” she said.
“OK,” answered Mack, still hugging Celia on the jungle floor, “Let’s head back to camp. There’s more light there.”
The small crew headed back to the beach hurriedly. The fire had started to burn more vigorously.
The jungle that enshrouded the beach was silent except for the occasional chirp of a whimbrel in the distance. They barely touched their food that night, granted, it was beans from a can that Paul made – it couldn’t have been very appetizing. Celia and Gina felt safer sleeping on the boat, so they took the rubber raft out to their trusty vessel.
Mack and Paul stayed on shore in their sleeping bags. Paul, accustomed to long hours digging in the desert, preferred sleeping on land. He cherished the moment, in fact, since he knew not when he’d sleep on land again. The fire began dying out, and the two men’s snoring grew louder. A figure lurked on the outskirts of the jungle.
The intruder headed towards their camp silently and bent on one knee in front of Paul. Mack, who always slept with one eye open, was quick. In a second, he grabbed the intruder by the calf and pulled him down. The dark man landed on his rear end, and Mack wrapped his thick arms around him and got his in a chokehold. Paul jumped to his feet and switched on his flashlight.
In Mack’s arms sat a black man with long natty hair and a beard. He stared into the flashlight wide-eyed and panicked.
“What do you want?” asked Paul. The man didn’t answer.
“Qu'est-que vouz voulez?” asked Mack in broken French.
“Manger,” answered the native, and in broken English, said, “Food.”
He was clearly not a threat to them. He was thin and lanky, and he looked weak. Mack let him go. Paul gave him the rest of the beans, which the man gobbled down instantly.
“Je m’appelle Jobey,” said the man.
Paul and Mack introduced themselves. Jobey expressed his pleasure to meet them and his gratitude. He then proceeded to walk to a nearby palm tree and lie down. In minutes, he was asleep. Paul decided to sleep as well, but Mack, always vigilant, decided it would be best for him to keep an eye on their new visitor.
The next morning, Gina woke the two men up. Celia was busy cutting some mangos. Jobey was nowhere to be seen.
“Where is he?” asked Paul.
“Where’s who?” asked Gina.
Suddenly, they could hear the loud thumping of bass. It was drawing nearer, louder.
“What the?” mumbled Mack.
A forty-meter yacht was approaching the shore. On the prow, stood Heath Browning, his long hair flowing, and his eyes behind sunglasses. On his enormous speakers he blasted Guns N’ Roses, sending sound waves rippling through the water.
Celia looked up from her mangos.
“Welcome to the jungle,” she muttered in disgust.
1111111111111.title: Mingling with the natives

11111111111112.content:
The sun was amazing that day. A lonely crab waddled from the shore into a tree trunk that had drifted to land that previous night. Every Hyophorbe Indica and Princess Palm on the island had at least two geckoes on it competing for the cornucopia of insects that invfested the island. The smart ones, Paul mused, were the ones who perched next to a spider web, stealing the prey from the startled arachnids. A striated heron perching on an Acanthophoenix palm was eyeing a vividly colorful gecko with interest. In these two animals, Paul could see millions of years of evolution. Dinosaurs aren’t extinct, he thought, they’re just smaller, more adapted to this world.
“Paul!” someone barked.
He turned around, awakened from his nature-induced trance, and eyed Heath, who had swum to shore. His muscles were bulging under his tanned skin, and his left arm was covered by a huge green tribal tattoo of a lizard that went from wrist to collar. His dirty blond hair dripped salty water onto his bronze shoulders.
“Cheers mate, how are you?” he asked Paul, removing his sunglasses.
Paul sucked in his stomach, “Great man! I’m happy you could join us.”
“You’ll be happier when you see what I brought,” said Heath with great satisfaction.
He turned and saw Mack standing behind him with his big arms crossed.
“Well look who it is,” muttered Heath, “Good old Mackey. The old Big Mack. ”
He walked over and put out his hand. Mack didn’t take it. Instead, he turned his back to Heath and said, “We set sail in an hour.”
Heath smiled cockily, obviously used to this kind of treatment. He shifted his focus on the women who were sitting on the sand eyeing him in disgust. They were eating Mangoes.
“Hello ladies,” he said smoothly, “Celia, Julia.”
“It’s Gina,” said Gina getting up and walking towards Paul.
“Wow,” blurted Heath, “what’s with everyone? Has somebody died?”
Mack turned to face Heath and walked up to him. He stuck his face less than an inch away from Heath’s face. Heath could feel the warm, dank breath of a man who hadn’t washed in days.
“Listen pretty boy,” said Mack, his nose touching Heath’s, “You follow OUR rules out here. If I get ANY problems from you, you’re swimming back to England.”
They stared intently into each other’s eyes for an eternity, and finally, breaking the silence, Heath let out an explosion of laughter.
“Man,” he giggled, “I’ve never seen anyone so wound up since the time I put glue in the headmaster’s shampoo! You should have seen HIS face!”
Mack shook his head in disgust, and Paul took over.
“Ok,” he began, “Let’s all relax. We’re going to have to get along and most importantly; we’re going to have to depend on each other. This mission is very dangerous and the last thing we can afford to lose is our cool,” he looked at the two men and added, “Now grow up! The two of you!”
“At least on my boat,” said Heath, “We’ll have enough room to stay out of each other’s way.”
“You boat?” asked Mack angrily, “We’re taking OUR boat. That’s the plan.”
“My boat has all the equipment in it,” answered Heath coolly.
Mack stared at him, unmoving. Gina looked at Paul, who was beginning to look worried.
11111111111112.title: Alpha Males

choices: "It's a stowaway," replied Mack, "I caught him stealing."
"It's my friend Jobey," replied Mack tersely, "He's a cook.&
111111111111121.content:
“We better get our stuff then,” growled Mack pushing the rubber boat into the water. He looked at Paul and then at Celia, “Are you coming?”
They all got in the raft, leaving Heath on the shore by himself. As Mack rowed towards their smaller boat, they heard Heath shout, “Nigel, get the boat alongside theirs!”
Mack was fuming, “Who the hell is Nigel?”
The engine on Heath’s boat roared as the large vessel began coasting up to Celia’s sailboat. A plank began to lower itself onto the deck of the smaller boat. On the starboard gunwale of Heath’s boat, was the name, “Saurus,” meaning “lizard” in Latin. A small man with a moustache stepped onto the plank and onto the deck of Celia’s boat.
“That must be Nigel,” muttered Paul sensing the heavy tension of Mack.
They reached their boat and brought up the raft. Gina went into the cabin to get their belongings, while Paul began packing his charts and nautical equipment on the bridge. Celia went to the galley to get the perishable food they had on board. Mack angrily threw some T-shirts into a bag and headed for the deck. He found his favorite harpoon and checked to make sure the springs were tight.
“You won’t need that Mr. Mack,” said the little mustached man, “We have something a lot more effective.”
Mack smiled with half his mouth and replied; “I never leave home without this.” He petted the harpoon like it was a cat.
Suddenly, a scream came from the galley.
“Celia,” whispered Mack running downstairs.
Paul looked up from his charts and followed the scream. When he reached the galley, he almost laughed at what he found. Mack held Jobey up by the armpits, crumbs and fruit covered his beard and his thin, holey shirt was soaked in milk. Celia was sitting on the floor screeching, and Paul had to take her away and assure her that everything was OK.
“A stowaway,” said Mack looking at the frightened Jobey’s eyes.
“J’ai faim,” he mumbled, a piece of canned corn falling from his lips, “I am hungry.”
“Looks like he’s always hungry,” joked Paul.
Heath emerged into the galley, dripping wet from the swim. He looked concerned and disgusted by the sight of Jobey. He noticed the harpoon on the table and pointed it at the lanky native.
“Who’s this joker?” he asked.
Mack looked at Heath intently, and then shifted his gaze to Paul. Paul shrugged and looked blankly at his friend. He could have sworn he saw a smile hiding under Mack’s stoic expression.
111111111111121.title: Bait....and switch

choices: "Let me show you the sub," answered Heath cooly.
"Dinner is served," said Heath, "I hope you're hungry."
1111111111111212.content:
The short man with a moustache turned out to be Nigel, the first mate of the Saurus. He seems to have grown up on a boat, because he was always barefoot, and his feet were flat as boards. His curly brown hair looked as if it had always been subjected to salty winds. His jolly face was covered with skin the texture of burlap.
Nigel wasn’t the only mate on the yacht. There was Weil, the quiet mechanic and Georgie, a self-proclaimed “professional” thrill seeker who followed Heath like the plague.
As Paul’s team boarded the Saurus, Paul could hear Heath complaining to himself about the stench coming from Jobey.
“Welcome aboard,” greeted Nigel.
Thank God, thought Paul, at least somebody on this expedition is sane.
“Why do I have the feeling this expedition is getting bigger?” asked Mack eyeing Weil and Georgie.
“We need all the help we can get,” answered Heath dryly.
“Where is our cabin?” asked Gina.
“Please follow me,” answered Nigel leading them below deck.
The interior was amazing, Paul felt like he was in a shrunken renaissance mansion. The wood that lined the walls was dark brown and lacquered, complementing the navy blue carpeting beautifully. This was a little over the top, he admitted, but it sure would be nice to ride in style. Nigel showed Gina and Paul their room. They entered and began unpacking.
Paul had never even seen such an expensive looking room in a hotel. The gold-rimmed king-size bed was adorned with silk sheets and caressed by silk curtains blowing over a porthole. They even had their own bathroom.
Gina put her arms around Paul’s neck and began kissing him.
“Welcome to the Love Boat,” she said with a smile.
Paul returned the kiss, and began undressing his wife. The moment was too perfect – this was better than a honeymoon. They collapsed onto the bed, intertwined. He took his pants off and she grabbed his buttocks. He let out a sigh and began fiddling with her bra-strap, trying to get it undone.
Suddenly, the door flew open and Mack barged in yelling, “Holy shit guys! You should see this place.”
Realizing he was interrupting an intimate moment, he mumbled a lame apology and quickly closed the door. Paul looked into Gina’s eyes and they both began laughing. After the laughing subsided, they made love and waited for the next person to barge in.
It didn’t take too long before Heath knocked on their door. Paul quickly got dressed and walked into the corridor. Everyone was waiting for them, including Jobey, who had no idea what was going on. By the looks on their faces, they all knew what Paul and Gina had been doing in there.
“What?” asked Paul sheepishly, “What’s going on?”
1111111111111212.title: The Love Boat

11111111111112121.content:
The newly formed crew headed for the stern of the Saurus. Heath was especially animated; he was jumpy and giddy as a child on a sugar high. He whistled and bounced jauntily as he walked up to the deck and towards the back of the giant yacht.
Paul was directly behind him, trying to peek over Heath’s bouncing shoulder, and devoured by anticipation. Directly behind Paul, Mack was grunting impatiently.
“You’re gonna love this,” said Georgie in an Australian drawl.
The small crew reached the stern, and Heath let out a satisfied sigh.
Paul finally realized why Heath was acting like a child. The sub was unlike anything he had ever imagined. It was roughly thirty feet in length and it was the shape of a fat cigar. The hull was painted white, and scattered with portholes. On its prow was a large domelike bubble, large enough to fit three heads comfortably. On the fore of the sub, were two mechanical arms equipped with titanium hands and retractable utensils.
“Here she is,” said Heath, “The Megalodon.”
Paul looked inside. There was enough room for six. In the back was a special decompression chamber that could fit a person in a deep-sea diving suit. It was even equipped with a refrigerator.
“Megalodon?” asked Jobey
“Megalodon,” answered Paul, looking up from the sub, “The fiercest shark to ever roam the seas.”
“Oh-oh,” said Gina rolling her eyes, “Here we go.”
“Megalodon,” continued Paul, “Which means ‘great tooth’ had teeth 6 inches long, and a jaw aperture of six feet. It was said to weigh more than a sperm whale, and could grow up to eighty feet in length! Some people claim to have seen Megalodon to this day, although it was probably a whale shark, or a great white.”
“I did my research too,” added Heath, “Those enormous sharks were deep sea divers. They could crush the shell of the thickest turtles. Hence, the sub’s name.”
“Where did you get this?” asked Mack incredulously.
“I’m not sure,” replied Heath.
“What do you mean, you’re not sure?” asked Mack.
“Well,” replied Heath, “It’s classified,” he shot a glance to Nigel and cocked his eyebrows, “I guess you could say I got her at an army surplus store.”
“Jesus,” answered Celia, “Who’s arm did you twist to get it?”
“Darling,” began Heath, moving into Celia’s personal space, “Sometimes all it takes is a little persuasion.”
Celia took a step back and mumbled, “Pig.”
He looked around with a smile and said, “Shall we take her for a dive?”
11111111111112121.title: Sub way

111111111111121211.content:
The consensus from the rest of the group seemed mixed as they sat in silence staring at the large metal submarine. Finally it was Paul who was forced to make the decision before anyone else objected. "Alright, lets saddle up. But dammit Heath you better know what you're doing." Heath smiled
his laid-back egocentric smile, revealing just enough teeth to make someone want to knock out his front canines.

"Don't worry Pops, I got it covered. Besides why would we all be here if it weren't for a little adventure? Don't kill the fun now." grinning he entered the rear of the Megalodon ushering the others to follow. Something about his personality seemed to defy theologic of human nature. Paul stood back as the others entered, attempting to gauge Heath's handle on the situation. As usual, he seemed cocky as ever, but never really put any good amount of thought into anything he did. Risks were simply something that he never trulyconsidered a possibility.

"Here Celia, take my hand. I'm sure you'll enjoy your space in the Megalodon. Gina, I'm quite sorry that I will have to sit in the front of the sub, because however much I wish to complement you on how fine you look today, important navigation must be done for the whole of the group."

"Shut up and show me where I'm going already."

"Fair enough, I've overstepped my bounds. I know that you're husbands is quite the man." He couldn't help but keep the lighthearted sarcasm out of his voice. He was lucky thatPaul was in a generous mood today because from his point of view, Heath was out looking fora broken nose. "Alright, come on Pops, try and bring your old frame in here. I know the arthritis doesn't help much, so that's why I'm here to give you a hand."

"My god Heath, you have no idea when to quit being such a smartass. I should have cracked you right in the face for talking to my wife like one of your little golddigger playboy models."

"Take it easy Paul, you know I'm the designated jester on this trip, and if I'm correct I thought I heard a little jealousy in your voice?" he was smiling that wry, punchable smile again.

"Just get me up there you massive goof off."

"There we go, now were on the same level. I was hoping you could manage a little kidding around, even with all of the 'serious' stuff you're doing!"

"Do you mind doing us all a favor Heath, and stop to take a breath every once in a while. We would appreciate the silence for a short amount of time."

"I just got to go through these couple of instructions and then I'll get out of your hair and let you sleep, Gramps." This time it was Mack who said something.

"Alright, get on with it pretty boy."

"Ok, first of all these switches up here belong to me and me only. That means all of you silly kids are going to have to keep your hands to yourself for the time being. Secondly, please don't bitch at me to stop and look at fish. You guys want to keep on the mission so that's what we are doing. Lastly, stay out of my hair unless you want your balls busted real good, or unless of course you're Gina or Celia in which case I will gladly keep you company. Comprende?" He couldn't keep that stupid looking smile off his face if he tried. It was easily learned by everyone there that the best way to deal with Heath was to simply not talk at all. So the crew of the Megalodon sat in silence as they plunged into the depths of the Indian ocean in search of the same cavern Paul had found earlier.
111111111111121211.title: "Let's take her for a dive!"

1111111111111212111.content:
"And we're off..." Heath's voice rang through the cabin of the steel sub much to everyone else's dismay. The Megalodon was only wide enough to fit the passengers in a single file line with it's small berth. It seemed insidious how Heath had arranged the order from front to back: him, Gina, Celia, Paul, and then Mack all the way in the rear. Everyone had noticed, but only now once they were already settled in. Gina could see even from behind how the corners off his mouth had pulled themselves into another smug grin. Was it possible that even his frat-boy attitude hid some kind of deep genius or feeling? As soon as the thought passed her head it almost seemed laughable. The man, if he could even be called that, was a womanizer in every sense of the word. Sure, he was wealthy, ambitious, and...well, damn good-looking, but he was no reliable or noble character. Surely his egoism about women was flawed.

"Preparing to dive, the chasm has been located. I would strongly advise hanging on, this baby's got some kick to it."
She couldn't help but notice how strong, yet sensual his voice was. Wait, what? She was married and this kid was already getting to her. It was unbelievable she could actually think anything sexual like that. Maybe he needed a little taste of his own medicine.

The ship nosedived hard and jumbled the crew around quite a bit. Gina used the opportunity to make it look as if she had been thrown up against the back of Heath's chair. Much to her surprise it seemed as though Celia had quite a similar idea. Unfortunately for her, her entrance was not nearly as smooth and she cracked the front of her nose directly on the back of his seat.

Heath immediately spun away from Gina, as if he almost never acknowledged her presence, to tend to the wounded Celia lying on the floor of the Megalodon. Mack must have realized that Celia was ejected from her seat because his voice called out from the far reaches of the sub. "Celia!"

Heath was quick and deft in his actions, which reminded Gina of one of those Japanese chefs that cooks on the open grills for entertainment. Almost inhumanly, he found the padding and the gauze, lifting her up by the small of her back to apply pressure to her bleeding nose. It looked almost romantic in a sense the way he was holding her, that is, if bloody noses and scrapes could ever be considered romantic. Still, Gina felt sharp pangs of annoyance with Celia for being so clumsy that she stole everyone's attention. Her nose had almost stopped bleeding and Heath was busy addressing a scrape which had brought his lips dangerously close to her face.

"Keep this bandage on for as long as you can, but before we dive we'll have to seal it up completely. I have some liquid skin in the kit. For now, keep pressure on your nose. The bandage on your arm is disinfected as well, so you won't have to worry about that." Gina noticed how his breath had flowed over the side of her neck, but then she reminded herself that this wasn't sensual at all. Nope. Meanwhile, Mack was throwing a temper tantrum in the back.

"Is that dirty rat touching you!? I swear I'm gonna..." Celia cut him off before he could list the horrendous things which he would make Heath endure. She looked into the rich playboy's eyes and swore she saw tenderness there.

"Everything's fine up here Mack, Heath is just helping me out since I was clumsy. Thank you, Heath. I never thought I would say that." this made him smile. Not the same egocentric sarcastic smile, but a genuine smile that was warm enough to melt any girl's heart. There were no girl's here, however, only women.

"It's all I could do to help, I hope it's enough." Again, those eyes drew her in, but she refused to be swept off her feet so easily.

"As I said, thanks." Gina felt the twinges of jealousy coming on, but dismissed them as best as she could because they were so unfounded. She couldn't help but feel relieved when Celia returned to her seat. Heath had sat back down at the controls and looked too busy to talk. This frustrated Gina slightly, though she channelled her emotions quite easily and decided it was time for this hotshot Brit to come face to face with what he really was. A scumbag. Nonetheless she would more than enjoy toying with him first.

"So, Captain Cool, how are we looking?" She managed to push herself up against the seat in such a way that her breast was firmly pressed against his shoulder blade. The move was extremely uncomfortable, yet was seamless and looked totally natural and accidental. Bingo.

"Gina." The response was so informal and unperturbed that it almost seemed rude. Adding to this, he hadn't even looked up from his station! Not giving in just yet, she ventured an arm around his back, resting her hand upon his shoulder near the base of his neck. She was laying the traps.

"Can we stop to look at fish?"

Heath spun around to find that Gina's face was a lot closer than it should have been. She had made an effort to brighten her eyes and leave her mouth slightly open in order to lure him in with the full shape of her soft lips. It shocked her to see how stony his expression was. Completely indifferent. Was something wrong with her approach?

"No." He said flatly, unconcerned with her emotionally charged pickup lines. One last try and then she could go back to treating him like the butt-end he was. Her hand was still perched on his shoulder. She began messaging him slowly, her fingers pushing against his strong neck and back muscles. When he had turned back around to face the control panel, Gina had surreptitiously moved her mouth close to his ear. This was the man-killer.

In the softest, sultriest voice she could muster she said, "Wow, Heath, you're really tense! I think the Captain needs to relax a bit..." He yawned.

"You're a very pretty girl Gina..." It was working! Time to go in for the kill.

"Hmm...hmm..."

"...But do you really think you can seduce me?" Oh crap, now what. The statement struck her like a brick wall. There was no getting around it. She was backed into a corner and now she had to fight her way out. His eyes were a deep blue like the ocean surrounding us.

"You're right, I'm too good for a rich man-slut like yourself." She turned to leave, angry at herself for being stupid enough to put herself in such a situation where some twenty-something douchebag had free reign to trod over her emotions. But how could he have known? He WAS still gorgeous...however awful he was.

"Gina, come here..." His voice was pure hypnotism! She turned around boiling up inside, but not willing to share anymore of herself with his kind. Like a depressed child she dulled towards this man. He was smiling that lover's smile again and she felt her stride falter for a second. Get yourself together, woman!

She was careful to keep her distance this time, and averted her eyes from his gaze. They sat quiet for what seemed like an eternity until Heath finally spoke. No longer was he a man of jokes and witticism. Now he was thoughtful and reticent, quite odd.

"They have all tried...repeatedly...the models I mean..." he was lost in thought and for the first time Gina could have sworn she saw a fraction of a deeply emotional side of this man. Perhaps he was just lost. "They all try to Snag a piece of the fortune. I've lost myself in many women only to find that they are truly heartless. The best ones, the ones who I trusted, they had this way of stealing you away. Let me show you..."

He planted a finger on Gina's chin and forced her to look up at him. The embarrassment was beginning to fade, but she still didn't know what to make of the situation. His eyes were bright in his modelesque face. "They say the eyes are gateways to the soul. Whenever you lie, whenever you smile, it's the eyes that convey the true meaning. To have believable eyes, you have to make believe yourself. You must see the love in them..."

As Gina stared into Heath's bright blue eyes and knew unmistakably what can only be described as love. The emotion which it carried seemed to overwhelm her. It enveloped her totally, and like a puppet on a string, when Heath reached out to touch the back of her neck, she brought her head forward instinctively, drawn in by his eyes. It was only when their lips touched that their passions were merged for an instant or an eternity. Tongues clashed and hair was combed. Each had a desire to be closer than the other. It was only when Heath stopped; abruptly it might have seemed, that Gina realized what had just taken place. His eyes were of the frat-boy again, laughing and egocentric.

"That, my dear friend Gina, is how to seduce properly. I can have it all on paper if you want a copy. Mind you, it might get a little pricey. The secrets of love and sex aren't easy to come by..."

"Screw you, Heath!! I hope you rot in a hellhole!!" She promptly slapped him upside the head.

"Ow! Hey, looks like we're here."
1111111111111212111.title: Everybody Loves Heath

11111111111112121111.content:
The sub had slowed down significantly so the passengers on Heath's vessel moved toward the front to get a better view. Celia was right over his shoulder again, followed by the ever adventurous Paul on the other side, staring out into the deepest blue with intense intrigue. Behind Celia, Mack was eyeing up Heath angrily, he wasn't sure what kind of mind games this character was capable of so he kept his fist clench should the need arise to sock him a good one right in his mouth. Off in the corner barely paying attention was Gina. She was still fuming over the make-out incident. Now she didn't want to be even within a couple hundred feet of the trashbag.

Paul must have noticed this peculiar acting. Being the supreme adventurer of the group he broke his gaze towards from the inside of the cavernous pit to attend to Gina strange behavior. "Gina, look! We've made it farther down int the chasm than we had diving! It looks almost endless!" His eyes were big and excited like that of an extremely manly child. Gina could only content herself with Mr Manventure for so long at a time. Paul quickly noted the coldness of her attitude. "Gina?"

"I'm really tired Paul, this trip is taking it out of me. I just need some peace and quiet for a little bit."

It took all of Paul's focus to draw his attention away from the adventure at hand to soothe his wife's needs, but he did it anyway. "Gina, I understand. Whatever you need just tell me. You know we can talk about anything."

Gina gained a little bit of her happy elf back then, and it became clear like it always had after a hard day why she had married this rugged man with a gentle heart. Still she hated Heath's guts and wasn't sure if she could deal with the fact that he was friends with her husband. She would save these issues for later once the mission was over.

"Radar is picking up some things ahead. It looks as if were about to enter a very narrow portion of the chasm. It might be a tight fit." Heath's voice came from the pile of people in the front of the boat. Mack was quick to retort.

"Alright sailor boy, let's see if you can keep us alive through this, because I swear to God if you put my wife's life in danger, you're going to be the first one to go."

Heath had no issue replying smartly to this obvious attack, even when Mack was pounding his fists together quite scarily. "Hey Big boy, you know I would never harm such a beautiful creature such as your wife. Besides if you want to get through this alive you're going to have to trust my driving"

Mack growled lowly. Paul put a hand on his longtime companion, he was going to need to relax if they all wanted to get through this as a team. That being said, if they lost Heath, they wouldn't have the equipment to continue. "Just try to deal with him for now, we'll be back on land soon enough and then you can do whatever it is you please."

Mack grinned a sinister grin, revealing a predatory smile. "Oh I'll be more than happy when that hour comes."

"Alright we're nearing the narrow part, I've put the sub in reverse so that gravity will or should carry us through very slowly. This isn't easy stuff so I suggest giving me a little room to breathe here for a little while. Thanks."

The crew of the Megalodon moved towards the rear of the ship, congregating near the seat of Mack's chair. Celia was the first to say something against the quiet of the subs backward humming. "Well, he seems nice enough..." Mack's eyes were fire. He couldn't believe his own wife could deal with such a jerk off like Heath. Paul once again was forced to play the mediator. It was a job he was good at, but was becoming harder now that everyone seemed to be turning on Heath. To be honest he wasn't a big fan of the guy himself, but he owed him for providing the necessary assistance without so much as the slightest quarrel. "Yeah, well, he's all we have right now. Unless one of you has an additional 5 million to throw at buying a sub for ourselves, I think he's our best bet."

"That doesn't mean have to like him, or even enjoy looking at his obnoxious face." Mack was still giving his wife the stink-eye for saying something about Heath. Celia was one of the few people who could argue a point with Mack and not pay with bruises or broken bones, perhaps this was why he chose her as his spouse. They were heavyweights in terms of arguing. Mack wasn't used to losing, but Celia made it a point to always win.

"Jesus Mack, you sound like a little kid. Grow a pair and get over yourself. Heath is here right now so we have no choice but to deal with him. This trip would go a lot smoother if we were all friends." Paul saw the conflict escalating, but was at a loss for anything to break the tension. Gina and Paul observed helplessly as Gina's gaze burned holes into Mack's head like a stare of pure death. Mack's eyes were unfaltering, a deep brown that refused to be penetrated. It looked like two boxers squaring off to go at it . Now it was just a matter of who would throw the first punch. And then something strange happened.

"Come here, you sexy psychopath!" Mack's deep voice came from the depths of his chest, ridden with lust. This surprised the other couple in the vicinity. Gina more than Paul. It could be expected what happened next.

Celia dove into Mack's lap, plopping her more voluptuous frame on top of Mack's large body. Like animals, they initiated the beginning rituals of courtship kissing and falling all over each other. Had Mack and Celia not been considered the alphas of their given genders it would have been slightly disturbing. Oddly enough, it seemed that a man with as much testosterone as Mack, and a woman as fierce as Celia could only love in a harsh, defiantly sexual way as they did. Still, Gina spoke up.

"Really, you guys?" She looked at Paul for help. He simply shrugged and laughed wholeheartedly. It is what it is. Heath's voice vibrated through the hollow of the sub. Mack growled again.

"I think we've made it through..."
11111111111112121111.title: Continue

11111111112.content:
They all agreed to dive again finding the bottom and spreading out to look for the hole again. Gina stirred up an octopus and leary of her, decided to attack and attach itself to her mask. She gently removed him and he quickly swam away, in case she wanted to make a meal of him. The sponges and sea anemones were such brillant colors. A moray eel surprised her, as he poked his head out between two large rocks. He looked as if he were knashing his teeth at her, but she knew he was just breathing and would retreat back into the crevice he had been hiding in. Good thing she wasn't a lobster, octopi, or small fish, or she would be a tasty meal for him.

She noticed several nursesharks on the sandy bottom, the only species of sharks that actually rest on the bottom of the ocean floor. She saw a large shadow above her and turned to look as Paul grabbed her arm. Was she in danger for real this time?
11111111112.title: Octopi, lobsters and sharks...oh my!

111111111121.content:
Was she in real danger this time? When Paul grabbed her arm, she was alarmed and turned to him for instructions of what they were dealing with and how to get out of the situation. She sensed there was no immediate danger, he merely wanted to get her attention. The shadow above her turned out to be a large school of tuna.

She followed him through a large crack in a rock wall, where Mack was waiting for them. Mack led the way as they followed closely behind him. Something was about to happen, she could feel the hairs on the back of her neck rise, call it woman's intuition or whatever, they were close to something.

Mack and Paul stopped abruptly and she bumped into the back of Paul and saw what they were looking at. It was a big stone building with a dome rising out of the middle, several tunnels leading out from it and small domes on the end of the tunnels. It was all lit up! How could that be? There was no electricity under the ocean.They had to dive even deeper, coming up under the largest dome floor. Ther was a large hole in the bottom and they swam towards the light and yes, as they took off their masks, there was air. They lifted themselves out onto the stone floor and stood up. They were very surprised to see a brass diving bell, suspended from the ceiling by chains and against a couple of walls, stood old timey diving suits with heavy brass helmets.
111111111121.title: Discovery of the city

1111111111211.content:
They took off their tanks and flippers and proceded to explore their surroundings. There were at least five tunnel entrances, maybe more. They took the one nearest them and discovered that the room at the end was divided into sections. The first room was where food must have been stored. The storage room was filled with the remains of fish and another room showed signs that plant life had been grown. There was another room with several crude looking tables and chairs, at least thats what they thought they should be.

The second tunnel had a glass roof over it and they watched as fish and dolphins swam by. The room at the end was used as a records room, and they found, not alien writings, but human. Paul picked up the journal. It began:

I do not know how we come to be here, we were on a deep sea mission when we lost control of our diving bell and ended up here. It was if the bell was sucked into this place all on it's own. We tryed several attempts to get our diving bell back to the top, but the quake sealed off our escape. Even with our diving suits, we could not get through, they were too big and heavy.

So many things are strange to us here. There are symbols throughout the place that we've never seen. The huge magnifying glass outside the window is where the daytime light hits it and we think is how we have lights and heat, but that is pure speculation on our part. There is a big metal machine in one of the rooms, we do not know what it is. We used things from the sea that were useful to us, such as, clam shells to eat off of and cleaned our teeth made from seaweed.

"They made toothpaste, with the binding agent alginate, which is derived from seaweed. Incredible!", Paul marveled. He put the journal back down. "Let's look around somemore."
1111111111211.title: Old timey scientist

11111111112111.content:
They found the big metal machine the man had talked about and found it to be a mechanical cal-
culator. There were toothed wheels, each engraved with numbers zero to nine. Each column contained sixteen wheels, read from top to bottom. The columns were fixed to shafts, raised and lowered by cams, attached to a crank. Cranking the handle would produce a single calculation, leaving the machine to produce the next number in sequence on the next turn of the handle.

"Can you imagine this being built 11,000 years ago? This alien race was very advanced, just as we've always thought them to be. As they say, light years ahead of us. This machine was not invented in our time, until the 1800's, by Charles Babbage and was never finished before he died. This is just incedible! I've got to check out the other rooms and especially that giant magnifying glass outside." Paul went off excitedly down another tunnel.
11111111112111.title: Light years ahead of humans

111111111121111.content:
After they had explored some other tunnels, they found a big wall of glass. Looking outside they saw some sort of rock wall with symbols and five lines pointing upwards.

"Paul, how did they make all this glass?", asked Gina.

"I'm assuming that they used the raw material silica, as we know it, sand. Pure silica has such a high melting point, that they would have had to bring the sand in, light the fire on the sand impregnated with soda, left behind from evaporated water. The soda reduces silica's melting point. Glass is very strong, if pulled lengthways,a flawless fibre of glass is five times stronger than the best steel." He pecked on the glass and an angelfish stopped feeding and stared at him.


"That's the damndest thing I've ever heard.", Mack said earnestly.

Gina felt the hairs prickle on the back of her neck. "Yeah, it is. I'm wondering where these guys went to? I mean we haven't found any human remains."

Paul and Mack decided they'd seen enough for one day and headed back to the diving room.
111111111121111.title: What happened to the scientist?

1111111111211111.content:
They were convinced that they had found the real Atlantis and couldn't wait to get back on the boat and tell Celia. They continued past tunnels towards the diving room.

Paul's voice rebounded off the walls as he spoke.
"I think the aliens were plant eaters and ate kelp that they harvested outside the dome. Did you know that a hundred pounds of kelp, when decomposed in airtight tanks, yields a hundred pounds of methane gas?"

Mack whistled at the prospect, as they rounded the corner into the diving room.

"Where's our airtanks and flippers?", Gina asked, wondering if they were in the wrong room, that perhaps there were two diving rooms and they had overlooked one.

"This is where we left them, I think.", Mack said, sounding a little concerned.

"Of course this is it. Look, there's a trail of water that dripped off our tanks..." Paul was cutoff by Gina.

"Yeah, but they didn't just walk off by themselves.", she said quietly. They looked around. The stone room was ominously quiet now, save for their breathing and the water lapping at the edge of the hole.
1111111111211111.title: Vanishes into thin air

11111111112111111.content:
"We'll just follow the trail and find out what's going on, c'mon." Paul led the group with Gina behind him, clinging to his shirt. He was her protector and he darn well better do his job.

They came to the first tunnel, where it turned the corner and the water trail ended at the wall. Paul was feeling of the wall, tapping on it and finally gave it a swift kick and a hidden panel opened. It was signifigantly darker inside, only two small circles of glass in the ceiling. Paul proceded, with Gina still behind him, when his foot hit something. He looked past the gloom and there were the remains of the men, skeletons, their rags of clothing hanging from their bones. Paul and Gina stooped to get a better look, Mack decided to keep his distance.

"I don't think these guys died of natural causes, take a look at the strange hole in this guy's head. Not a gun wound that I ever saw." Paul scooted over so Mack could have a look.

"Me either.", Mack said. "And this one's leg is bent behind him, as if he were thrown against the wall with tremendous force."

"Yeah, this last one's neck is broken and distended greatly, like he was carried by his head." Paul and Mack stood up and looked at each other.

"Here's our equipment guys. May I remind you that we don't have any weapons on us, so I suggest we get out of this place and come back fully armed tommorow and figure this out." Gina was getting slightly spooked.

"Yeah, let's grab our stuff and get the heck out of here for now.", Paul agreed with her.

They grabbed their equipment and headed for the door, which promptly slammed shut before their eyes.

"Who or whatevers here, doesn't want us to leave.", whispered Gina, straining her ears to hear past the door.
11111111112111111.title: Trailing the lost equipment

111111111121111111.content:
Paul held Gina against his chest and kissed her forehead. Mack looked at her reassuringly and she smiled back at him, to let him know she was okay.

It would be dark soon, up top, but Celia probably wouldn't call anyone for awhile. One, she knew they had probably lost track of the time and two, she would not be in a hurry to call the authorities because they didn't have all the necessary papers to be diving there. She'd be worried, but she would wait it out.

They got tired and sat down, watching the last of the light dwindle from the small skylights above and as far away from the skeletons as possible. Gina could see that both the men were trying to figure out what to do next.
111111111121111111.title: Dwindling daylight

1111111111211111111.content:
"Doesn't it make you guys wonder how many other secret rooms are hidden around here?", Gina pondered aloud.

"She's got a point.", said Mack. "Something's hiding somewhere in here and it's not in any of the rooms we've checked out, so far."

Paul rubbed his chin in thought. "I agree, but the only rooms you see from the outside are the ones we've been in. It may be an optical illusion of some sort, I don't know, I'm just guessing."

"I feel as if we're being watched. It's creepy like a crazy game of cat and mouse, only we can't get out to chase or be chased." Gina placed her head on Paul's shoulder and he held tight to her hand.

As if someone had been listening, the panel door slid open and light from the tunnel flowed in over them.
1111111111211111111.title: More hidden rooms?

11111111112111111111.content:
"Gina, grab your equipment and head for the diving room, Mack, lead the way, I'll bring up the rear."

Paul shoved Gina's tank and flippers at her and kissed her quickly. He then grabbed his own and waited till Mack was a little ahead and told Gina to go.

Gina stumbled along, wishing that she could see Mack up ahead of her. She was going slowly, cautiously, running her hand along the stone wall as she went. She heard an odd humming noise and stopped, then she heard Mack cry out in pain.

She threw down her equipment and without thinking ran forward to help Mack, abandoning fear for her own safety to help her friend.
11111111112111111111.title: Time to leave

111111111121111111111.content:
Mack was nowhere in sight, as she ran along the tunnel to the diving room. She stopped and listened and saw droplets of blood on the floor. This was serious. Where was Paul? He had been right behind her.

She heard a humming noise coming towards her.She backed up against the wall. The hirs on the back of her neck stood up and she sensed great danger.

She ran in the opposite direction, in hopes of running into Paul. When she had already reached the secret room, her heart sank as she realised Paul had dissapeared too.

Dear God, she said to herself, please let them be alright. She opened the panel and ducked inside as she heard the humming getting closer and closer.
111111111121111111111.title: Come out wherever you are....please

1111111111211111111111.content:
Gina thought her breathing was going to give her away as she climbed in behind the skeletons for camoflage. She tryed not to breathe hard because the smell of the corpses was not pleasant, not rotting flesh smell, but dusty, moldy, long been dead smell.

She heard the humming noise outside the door, but couldn't see anything but the huge shadow it cast across the doorway. This thing, whatever it was, was monster size, bigger than a man. She squeezed her eyes tight and took small breaths, hearing the humming come even closer.
1111111111211111111111.title: Monster size

choices: wake up in a darker place
11111111112111111111111.content:
A small beam of light, like a laser beam, was shone around the room. Twice she was sure she had been discovered, when the light stayed in one place too long. Probably my wild hair sticking out, she thought, trying to keep her wits about her, but shaking like a leaf in a windstorm.

She heard the sound of huge, pounding footsteps now, as the thing came closer to the pile of bones. Why hadn't she heard footsteps before? Now the humming had stopped. She felt like she was going in and out of conciousness and it would have been possible from holding her breath for so long. Maybe it would be best to not know what was going to happen.
11111111112111111111111.title: All alone

111111111121111111111111.content:
The big footsteps were retreating, then the humming noise again, then it was gone. Gina climbed out from behind the skeletons and drew in a long awaited breath.

Stepping cautiously out into the hall, she listened to her own breathing and nothing else. She had to find Mack and Paul. She wouldn't have much to live for if she found Paul....dead.

She had to stop thinking like that, of course they were okay and she would find them and wake up from this nightmare and the real Atlantis would be a wonderful place, just like in all the history books.
111111111121111111111111.title: Breathe...just breathe

1111111111211111111111111.content:
She went down the tunnel and into the diving room, cautiously looking behind her all the while. That was strange, the diving bell had been lowered to the floor.

She tensed as she heard the humming noise again, then a moaning sound. She hid behind a wall and tryed to peek around the corner and not be seen. She couldn't believe what her eyes were seeing, a monstrosity, unlike anything she'd ever seen!
1111111111211111111111111.title: The monster

11111111112111111111111111.content:
It was a robot, seven feet tall, made of gleaming metal.It had a laser light on it's head and wheels on it's feet. That's where the humming was coming from, the wheels! It was carrying something in it's metal arms to the diving bell. Oh no, it was poor Mack, as limp as a ragdoll.

It had Mack slung over one arm and when it got to the diving bell, the wheels retracted and with heavy, spaceboot feet, it walked into it, dumping the unconscious Mack on the floor. It walked out, shutting the door and proceded to lift the bell out over the water.

She had to do something or Mack would be dumped into the ocean and who knows how long it would be before he would be revived...if he ever was.
11111111112111111111111111.title: Seven feet of gleaming metal

111111111121111111111111111.content:
She ran to the plate glass window and a large grouper eyed her. She had to create a diversion so the robot would follow after her. She pounded on the glass and immediately heard the humming noise coming towards her and she ran for her life.

Running quickly through the tunnel, something reached out and grabbed her. She sucked in her breath startled but then realized that it was Paul, dear, sweet Paul, alive and standing before her. All was not alright though, she noticed, as he slumped against the wall, his face bloody and his other arm hanging limp at his side.
111111111121111111111111111.title: Come get me sucker

1111111111211111111111111111.content:
"Oh God Paul, you're alive!" She hugged him tight and he sucked in his breath at the pain in his arm. She released him gently and looked at him wishing it was her pain and not his.

"My arm's broken. Whatever that thing was slugged me across the face with alot of force and I fell with all my weight on my arm." He winced and smiled a small smile to let her know he would live, if they could just get out of there.

She put his good arm around her shoulders and he told her to turn right. He kicked at a panel and again the door slid open and they went in. He kicked it again and it shut.

"This is where I have been for the past hour. I finally figured out the secret to opening it again was a swift kick."
1111111111211111111111111111.title: Kung Fu comes in handy

11111111112111111111111111111.content:
"Paul, it's a robot. A huge robot. The aliens must have left it here to guard the place till they get back. It's been tracking me and it'll find us here and kill us." She could feel herself on the edge of losing it. Paul smiled at her, he would make everything right and get them out alive. She had to believe that and not give up hope.

"Gina honey, listen to me carefully....it will probably come back here and check on me, I don't think it has eyes or anything.."

"No, it has a laser beam that tracks movement. I hid behind the skeletons and it didn't detect me."

"Okay, then you just hide behind me and I'll act like I'm out cold and hopefully it will leave." He kissed her on the lips and said ouch from his split lip and Gina hid behind him as best she could.
11111111112111111111111111111.title: The waiting game

111111111121111111111111111111.content:
The humming stopped outside the door and then heavy footsteps pounded in their chests along with their thundering heartbeats. The door slid open and the laser beam swept the room a couple of times and the footsteps retreated and then the humming ceased. They still remained for a few more minutes till their hearts stopped pounding and their breathing was normal.

"Paul, we have to hurry. The robot has Mack in the diving bell and is going to dump him in the ocean. He's unconcious and he'll die without any air."

"Alright, but we have to make one stop first."
111111111121111111111111111111.title: Friend in need

1111111111211111111111111111111.content:
They arrived in the diving room and to great relief, found the bell still hovering above the water. They pulled it back onto the stone floor, raised the metal latch, and opened the heavy door.

Mack lay inside, looking like a ragdoll, that had been carelessly tossed into the toybox for later playtime. They revived him, and he sat groggily on the floor, wondering what had happened. They gave him a quick rundown and gathered their equipment together for an escape.

"what if we tricked the robot into believing that Mack is still in the bell and trap him?", Paul said, thinking that it just might work.

The others agreed, and Gina helped Mack get his airtanks on and then her own.
1111111111211111111111111111111.title: So little time

11111111112111111111111111111111.content:
Paul climbed up and got one of the heavy diving suits and put it in the bell. Gina had managed to get Mack revived enough to stand as Paul told them to duck out of site behind the bell, and not a minute too soon for they heard the humming sound, the noise they had come to dread.

Paul waited until the robot went inside the bell and he slammed the door on the huge hunk of metal and threw the latch closed and locked it. He then took two long, tube shape cartridges and threw them into the air hatch and closed it shut tight. He swung the bell out over the water and dropped it into the water. The water splashed out running around their feet and sank fast. The further and faster it sank, the better.
11111111112111111111111111111111.title: Load and lock!

choices: explosion causes the structure to collapse
111111111121111111111111111111111.content:
"Paul, what did you put in the air hatch?", Gina asked as she watched the bell drop out of site.

Paul also followed the bell sinking with his eyes, glad to be rid of the evil cargo it carried. "Just a couple of tubes of methane gas. Once the inside of the bell compresses, it will squeeze the tubes of gas and kaboom, no more bad guy." He laughed, holding his arm in pain.

"You're a genius", Mack said, leaning on Gina for support. "How long will it take?"

"In about five, four, three...hit the floor guys."

Everyone hit the floor as a small explosion erupted and shook the stone walls.

"Lets get you two out of here and get you patched up", Gina ordered them and they did not argue.
111111111121111111111111111111111.title: Big boom

1111111111211111111111111111111111.content:
Celia heard the sound of divers popping up through the water and ran to help pull them aboard. She looked at the pale faces and knew it had not gone well.

"Oh dear, Mack honey, are you okay? What on earth happened down there?" Not even waiting for an explanation, she ran to get the first aid kit and began patching them up, as she listened to their incredulous story.

"Well it's getting dark and you all should get some rest." She ushered them to their bunks where they fell into needful sleep.

They all had a good nights sleep and was ever so grateful to see the sun was up and shining down upon them as Celia got breakfast together.
1111111111211111111111111111111111.title: To live another day

11111111112111111111111111111111111.content:
Celia brought out a tray of bagels, fruit and cheese for breakfast, setting it down and dissapearing down below. She came out once again and everyone looked up as they heard the strange tinkling of glass. They saw a smaller version of the magnifying sphere that they had seen below and then the sun was blinding them as it bounced off the glass. They sat in a trance, not seeing, not hearing.

"Now you don't think I could let you tell everyone where my lost city is, do you? My ancestors would not be very happy with me, would they?" She gave a small chirp, putting away the sphere and put wine glasses before the three.

They looked at her groggily as she held up her wine glass.

"I'm sorry you didn't find the lost city, but better luck on your next adventure." She smiled at them and felt Mack's hand squeeze hers gently.

She knew that the man would someday reveal her secret to these humans and she would have to erase it from their memory. Soon the old man would die and Atlantis would be safe to start another colony, deep beneath the sea.
11111111112111111111111111111111111.title: The worst is over

111111111121111111111111111111111111.content:
The old man rubbed the scar on his arm as it burned and itched. The boy was looking up at the tv on the wall and listening to music through headphones on his ears. He frowned at his grandpa as the screen went black and he motioned for him to take the headphones off.

"Bryan, I want you to listen to something I have to tell you. It's something that happened to me a long time ago." He cupped his hand over the scar, as if to seal the pain in, to no avail.

"I was at Roswell when the aliens crashed...."


The End.
111111111121111111111111111111111111.title: A young boy listens

11111111112112.content:
“We have three more entrances to explore.” said Gina. “Let’s split up.”

Before Paul could reply Gina went into the next tunnel. There were symbols lining the walls along the tunnel. These symbols were also above each door she came to. She decided the symbols must be indications of what each room contained. She looked in all these rooms lining the tunnel. Most of them looked like personal quarters, and smelled like sweaty socks. As Gina looked down the tunnel she saw what seemed to be a large room with a bluish glow and symbols larger than any of the others.
When Gina made it to the open door of the room she looked inside. She couldn’t believe her eyes. Before her stood a huge metal machine that took up at least half of the room. There were many small colored lights that marked buttons and levers along the front of the machine and a large globe that hovered at the top of the machine. The globe had a blue glow that gave the room a ghostly feeling.
As Gina stepped closer to the machine a projection shot out from the blue globe and immediately standing before her was a tall slender life form.

“I am Information Processor One. Ipo for short.” said the projection. “What information may I help you with?” the projection asked.
11111111112112.title: Gina's Exploration

111111112.content:
Then Celia turned towards the diving equipment. As she turned around, the corner of her pants got caught on the sharp corner of a metal shelf that was protruding from the wall.

The sharp corner ripped her pants, leaving a gaping hole for the others to see her bare skin. But wait! What should have been pinkish-colored flesh was actually scaly green. She quickly tried to cover up the gaping hole in her pants, but was quickly noticed by her husband.

"Yabba doobee lonta ooshee!" he screamed as he quickly ripped off his rubber mask which had made him look like a human.

Yellow bulbuous eyes protruded from his scaly green face, and long sharp ears popped out from the sides of his mask as he removed it.

"Joobee joobee, la moontee!" He shouted toward Celia, as she too ripped off her mask.

The others screamed in panic and tried to jump off the boat, but Celia's husband (whose real name was Bontee) grabbed one of the others by the arm and quickly proceeded to biting his head off.

Blood squirted from the lifeless body's neck and quickly covered the deck of the boat.

Then Celia turned toward the body and started to...
111111112.title: Violence

1111111121.content:
"Yummy!" Celia shouted out as she bit into the flesh and started to eat the body. "This tastes like Chicken!"

Then one of the other people on the boat whipped out an M-16 and started to fire upon the two ugly, scaly, green things.

"Die, you bastards!" he shouted as the gun screamed with noise.

Then Celia turned towards him, and squealed "Labba Dabba, you stupid mortal!" as the bullets bounced off her thick hide.

She then started hobbling towards the person, who...
1111111121.title: Unneccessary Violence

choices: Agree with Paul - there's no time like the present
Book into a hotel and relax for the night
11112.content:
Gina and Paul decide to enlist the help of their friends Mack and Celia in their quest to find the Lost City. They also hire too other guys, John and Ross, who seem pretty capable and have been to the Indian Ocean before. And also, to Celia's delight, they were HOT! "You must have played some part in this", Celia murmured to Gina as they boarded their plane.

They finally arrived in the city of Junita after a very long journey. Paul wanted to start looking for the city right away, but Gina wasn't so sure. What do they do?
11112.title: A Reliable Crew

choices: They hire a marine expert to help them
Paul liked to sail in his youth, give him a map and he'll figure it out!
111121.content:
The team wasn't lacking in enthusiasm, but they were lacking in both funding and a decent plan of action. Who was going to give them a grant to go alien-hunting? So with just the money in their pockets, they sit around in the choking hot streets of India trying to figure out what to do next.

"Isn't it obvious? We need to rent a boat, and start working on a sonar chart," said Ross.

"Nuh uh," Paul glumly reminded him. "Atlantis was built in a location that evades sonar, remember?"

"Then I guess we need a submarine," said Ross.

"That's all well and good, but how do we even know where to start looking?" Gina said in exasperation.

"Shadow zones!" Celia said, lighting up. "Isn't that what you called them? Locations in the ocean that sonar can't penetrate!"

The other team members agree and pat Celia on the back for her ingenuity. Now all they need is a map of the ocean floor.
111121.title: In India, entirely without a plan

choices: "We should stay until we know for sure the map is accurate."
1112.content:
"Ha-ha, do you really expect me to believe that? That's just a little outrageous for my taste." At that time Mack came in the trailer, brimming with excitement. "You won't believe what we just found! Come with me and check this out." As they walked to the sight Paul said "Well, what is it?" You'll see when we get there" said Mack. "Awww, come on!", said Gina. "I am dying to know what it is!"
