Mack said "I won't even try to explain what it is, but I do believe that we will be the first to have found one!"


"Unbelievable", said Paul and Gina in unison. "So," said Celia, "what do you make of it?" Gina opened her mouth to talk, but could find no words to convey just what she thought. Paul said" I would never had guessed we would ever find a map of Atlantis here!" The most amazing thing about it was the fact that it was written in english, but had some strange hieroglyphics around the map itself. " "I can't wait to get the sub in the water", said Celia. "Me either", Mack said.



Mack and Celia were probably the only couple that owned a submarine for personal use. They have a great deal of money, acquired when they were the first couple to provide hard evidence that aliens had, in fact, visited the planet throughout history, and gave knowledge to the ancient world. The aliens provided the knowledge to build such things as the pyramids, the Nazca Plains, and architecture, all of which were a total mystery to
science. "So, when do we leave?" Paul asked Mack and Celia.
1112.title: The map

11121.content: "I'm coming, I'm coming," Paul shouts as he runs out the door with his laptop under arm. "You nerd can't you go anywhere without your precious computer!" Gina says snickering. "No wonder you don't have a girlfriend." "Do i hear a bit of jealousy in your tone Gina?!" as the two run to the submarine waiting for its departure. "Welcome to the US Mack!" replies Mack with a look of excitement only topped by a 5 year old in a candy store. "Map?" "check" "wet suites?" "check" "oxygen tanks?" "check" "harpoon?" "check" "wait a sec what do we need a harpoon for?!!?" Paul manages to ask with a stutter. "well in case we get bored with trying to find Atlantis and decide to hunt whales what else!" laughing Mack says "lighten up buddy your in good hands" Now at this point Paul isn't so sure he should have even opened his mouth last night about Atlanits, but its too late to turn around now. Besides everyone else seems so excited for a little fun on this trip and Lord knows Paul could use a little in his life. "Your right Mack let the good times roll...I trust you man!" Little did he know that in just a mere couple of hours he would have made the worst decision of his life.
11121.title: Don't forget to pack!

choices: The brave "archaeologists" press on, adventure awaits.
Sandra publishes her results and debunks the crackpots.
11122.content:
'It's an obvious forgery," Sandra, the experienced lab technician informed her clients. She wouldn't have even run the tests, but when the client was loaded and willing, and the lab could barely afford to curate the artifacts, let alone pay the techs a dollar above minimum wage...

"What?!" exclaimed the four annoying 'archaeologists' (and Sandra used the term extremely loosely when applying it to these particular people).

"That can't be!" Gina voiced her disbelief.

"But we found it at a site in Mexico!" objected Mack. "And, as we have already proven to the world before, the aliens were clearly involved in the development of the civilizations located there!"

Sandra couldn't help but roll her eyes. She hid the gesture by turning back around to the image of the 'map' on her computer screen, although there was no need to refer to it instead of the original, considering how obviously contrived the 'ancient alien map' had been.

Four years of undergraduate and two years of masters study for this!

"Look," she said, beginning to lose her patience. "It's not ancient, it's not even old! The yellowing is amateur at best, more on par with the technique children use to make treasure maps."

The four 'experts' stared blankly at her. She knew the type. Crackpots, pseudoscientists...they'd only hear what they wanted to hear. That was why she ran the tests, as if they'd pay any attention to those either. They wouldn't know real proof if it smacked them in their dense skulls. The lucky bastards just happened to be able to sucker a rich old looney into believing their psychotic theories and leaving them all his money.

"See this test result right here," she pointed it out explicitly, had highlighted and bold-faced the results in anticipation of their arrival. "This says that a substance in the analysis of the paper was tea leaves. This document was falsely aged, and rather superficially, with a tea bag!"

"The aliens must have made it look like a forgery to fool those without enough courage and faith to discover Atlantis," Mack said. "But we have plenty of that, and no underqualified lab technician can tell us otherwise! No one can stop us no matter-"

"It's written in crayon for god's sake!" Sandra exclaimed.
11122.title: An Obvious Forgery

Finding Atlantis way beneath the sea can be dangerous enough, not counting the evil found lurking after centuries, for anyone who dares enter uninvited.
